snippet: Envoys, including from Middle Eastern powers, have been meeting recently to try to head off a Syrian collapse that could strengthen the Islamic State.
abstract: Russia, United States and Saudi Arabia are among countries engaged in efforts to resolve Syria's civil war; Pres Bashar al-Assad is confronted with battlefield setbacks from Islamic State.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sabrina Tavernise and Nikolay Khalip from Moscow, Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran, Eric Schmitt from Washington, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and Ben Hubbard and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Envoys, including from Middle Eastern powers, have been meeting recently to try to head off a Syrian collapse that could strengthen the Islamic State.

headline.main: New Diplomacy Seen on U.S.-Russian Efforts to End Syrian Civil War
headline.print_headline: Battlefield Setbacks for Assad’s Forces Prompt a Flurry of Diplomacy on Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
